item.title: Castor Oil Packs- Healing for PMS, Endometriosis or GI symptoms
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
Castor Oil Packs What is Castor Oil? Castor oil is a multi-purpose vegetable oil that people have used internally and externally for thousands of years. Externally (what we are talking about), castor oils is an excellent moisturizer, it promotes wound healing, reduces acne, fights fungus, it’s an great anti-inflammatory source and it gets your adrenals

The post Castor Oil Packs- Healing for PMS, Endometriosis or GI symptoms appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
Castor Oil Packs

What is Castor Oil?

Castor oil is a multi-purpose vegetable oil that people have used internally and externally for thousands of years.

Externally (what we are talking about), castor oils is an excellent moisturizer, it promotes wound healing, reduces acne, fights fungus, it’s an great anti-inflammatory source and it gets your adrenals moving.

Castor Oil Packs

We recommend Castor Oil Packs regularly because of the incredibly healing effects they have and it’s another wonderful at home self treatment you can do in between your acupuncture treatments.  They are great for fertility (when your uterus is on the colder side), great for PMS symptoms including PMDD and endometriosis and great for stagnant or inflammatory GI problems.

Side note: When using for fertility we recommend only using every other day on day 3 of your cycle until ovulation.  It is contra-indicated for pregnancy.

You’ll Need

  • castor oil pack kit
  • Some sort of water (oil) proof barrier like a plastic trash bag
  • heating pad or hot water bottle

How to Use a Castor Oil Pack

  1. Take your wool cloth or flannel cloth and cut it down to fit your lower abdomen
  2. Soak cloth in castor oil (but not dripping soaked)
  3. Find a comfortable laying space making sure to put a dry towel underneath to prevent staining sheets or couches.
  4. Place the oil soaked cloth on your lower abdomen
  5. Place your barrier material on top of the cloth
  6. Put your heating pad or hot water bottle on top of the barrier
  7. Lie on back with feet elevated  and relax for 20-45 minutes.
  8. Use this time to practice deep breathing, read a book, meditate or whatever you find relaxing.
  9. After the desired time, remove the pack and place your castor oil cloth in a glass container as you can use it up to 30 times!  It’s recommended to keep it in the refrigerator.
  10. Wipe any extra oil off your skin with soap and water or let it soak in.
  11. Be sure to drink a lot of water on these days as your body will be detoxing.

 

The post Castor Oil Packs- Healing for PMS, Endometriosis or GI symptoms appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: Blood Building Tips
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
Blood Deficiency The concept of blood in traditional Chinese medicine shares a close relationship with the western concept in that it has both a nourishing and moistening function. However, with the concept of blood deficiency, emphasis is placed on your body’s qi. Blood is seen as a condensed form of qi, with qi playing a

The post Blood Building Tips appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
Blood Deficiency

The concept of blood in traditional Chinese medicine shares a close relationship with the western concept in that it has both a nourishing and moistening function. However, with the concept of blood deficiency, emphasis is placed on your body’s qi. Blood is seen as a condensed form of qi, with qi playing a vital role in helping the blood to circulate to where it is needed. Attention is also focused on the strength of your digestive system’s ability to successfully obtain the nutrients from your food necessary for the production of blood.

Symptoms include: dizziness, palpitations, insomnia, dry skin a/or hair, poor memory, paleness, fatigue, scanty periods 

Food to build blood includes: 

•Grains: barley, corn, oats, rice, sweet rice, wheat, bran 

•Vegetables: alfalfa sprout, artichoke, beetroot, button
mushroom, cabbage, celery, dandelion leaf, dark leafy greens, kelp, shiitake mushroom, spinach, watercress, wheatgrass 

•Fruit: cherry, apple, apricot, avocado, date, fig, grape, longan, mulberry 

•Beans: aduki, black soya, kidney 

•Nuts and seeds: almonds, black sesame 

•Fish: mussel, octopus, oyster, sardine, tuna 

•Meat: all red meat especially bone marrow and liver
(beef, pork, sheep) 

•Dairy: chicken egg,

•Herbs, spices: nettle, parsley 

•Oils, condiments: amasake, molasses 

•Beverages: soy milk 

  • Supplement – Floradix- Iron+Herbs

The post Blood Building Tips appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: SPRING WELLNESS TIPS
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
1. Cover your neck Springtime colds prevail when we fail to cover up our necks, shoulders and upper backs. In Chinese Medicine, we believe that certain pathogens enter the exterior of our bodies through the nape of our necks. That is why if a cold persists there is typically achiness in the neck, shoulder and

The post SPRING WELLNESS TIPS appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
1. Cover your neck

Springtime colds prevail when we fail to cover up our necks, shoulders and upper backs. In Chinese Medicine, we believe that certain pathogens enter the exterior of our bodies through the nape of our necks. That is why if a cold persists there is typically achiness in the neck, shoulder and upper back area.

2. Get to bed before 11pm

Our livers are important organs in the spring and regenerate from the hours of 11pm until 1am so it’s important to be horizontal and relaxing during that time.

3. Eat Seasonally

Drinking tons of lemon water and eating lots of greens, sprouts, seeds, nuts and fruits gives your body just what it needs to detox from the winter and refresh for the new season.

4. Tackle New Projects

Our bodies and minds are designed to give you energy to make lists, start new tasks and move forward in this season so take advantage!

5. See your Acupuncturist

We have specific treatments that are designed to help you live your best life within each season.  Feeling tight, irritable, frustrated or achy?  That’s a good sign you’re in need of a treatment.

The post SPRING WELLNESS TIPS appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: Chinese Secret – Congee
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
Congee is a grain based, medicinal porridge served for centuries in traditional East Indian and Chinese homes.  We’ve been talking to a lot of you about this dish that I have so much respect for.  We have learned about it in school in a cooking class we had.  After years of treating, We are noticing how

The post Chinese Secret – Congee appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
Congee is a grain based, medicinal porridge served for centuries in traditional East Indian and Chinese homes.  We’ve been talking to a lot of you about this dish that I have so much respect for.  We have learned about it in school in a cooking class we had.  After years of treating, We are noticing how many of us struggle with weak digestions and how much it is effecting our lives and long term health.  We invite all of you to incorporate this easy, affordable and deeply nourishing meal into your homes.

In Traditional Chinese Medicine the spleen and stomach are a huge part of genre health and well being.  When they are strong and functioning properly, the rest of the body is able to strengthen.  The typical American diet weakens these systems over time leading to epidemic dis-ease.

Congee is healing in the sense that those who need to lose weight will lose it and those who need to gain weight will gain it.  It’s especially good for those who have fatigue, reflux, bloating or gas after eating.  It’s great for anyone who is sick and for those with weakened immune system or chronic diseases.  The body will have more energy to heal because it is not overworking to process food that is difficult to digest.  When you incorporate this as a regular dish, you’ll see major improvement in digestive functions and the consistent level of physical energy and mental clarity throughout the day.

 

Here are instructions as well as a couple of our favorite Congee recipes, however, please get as creative as you want!

Congee Basic Ingredients

1 cup grain (rice, millet, barley, quinoa)

8 cups chicken broth or water

1 Tbsp butter/oil

Slow Cooker

Combine basic ingredients in slow cooker and cook at low heat 8 hours.

Using a pressure cooker

Combine basic ingredients in pressure cooker and cook on high for 20 minutes.

Suggested Toppings before cook:    

Shredded beef, pork or poultry

Vegetables (carrots, sweet potatoes, cabbage, radish, kale, etc.)

Soy sauce, hot sauce, chili paste, fish sauce, amino acids, etc.

Nuts/Fruits (walnuts, almonds, dates, dried cherries)

Spices/Dry Herbs (ginger, garlic, cinnamon, cayenne, etc.)

Suggested Toppings after cook:

Fresh herbs (scallions, parsley, cilantro, etc.)

Poached or fried egg

Flavorings (honey, maple syrup, milk)

Our Favorite Sweet Recipe
CINNAMON & SUGAR CONGEE

1 cup rice, 8 cups water and 1 Tbsp grass fed butter

Cooked with sweet potato, dates, chopped ginger, cinnamon, and clove.

Add maple syrup, chopped walnuts and a dash of almond or cashew milk to serve.

Our Favorite Savory Recipe
BACON & EGG CONGEE

1 cup rice, 8 cups water and 1 Tbsp grass fed butter

Sauté bacon, eggs, onion and garlic.
Add sauteed ingredients and chopped kale, chili paste and amino acids to rice, water and grass fed butter.

Add scallions, toasted sesame oil and a fried egg to serve.
Tamari/Amino Acids to taste.

The post Chinese Secret – Congee appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: Reiki, Summer Reads and Acupuncture Insurance 🙌
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
Have you heard about Reiki but don’t know anything about it!?  Here are some important facts to know. Everyone has the ability to channel Reiki. It originates from Japan in the early 1900’s The person channelling the Reiki does not cure the person receiving the treatment. The person receiving the Reiki cures them-self. In recent studies,

The post Reiki, Summer Reads and Acupuncture Insurance 🙌 appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
Have you heard about Reiki but don’t know anything about it!?

 Here are some important facts to know.

  • Everyone has the ability to channel Reiki.
  • It originates from Japan in the early 1900’s
  • The person channelling the Reiki does not cure the person receiving the treatment. The person receiving the Reiki cures them-self.
  • In recent studies, Reiki has shown to improve sleep, reduce pain, nausea and anxiety.
  • Reiki can be given to people, animals, plants, food and water. Almost anything in fact.
  • Over 800 hospitals in the country incorporate Reiki into their patient services
  • Reiki should not be given to anyone without their knowledge and consent.
  • Reiki energy can be sent at a distance, anywhere in the world.
  • There is a limitless source of universal energy. Reiki does not deplete the energy of the person channelling Reiki.
  • Reiki acts at a physical, mental, emotional and spiritual level.
  • You can give self-treatments with Reiki.

Our Summer Read Recommendation

Braving the Wilderness: The Quest for True Belonging and the Courage to Stand Alone by Researcher. Storyteller. Texan, Brené Brown

Our Summer Podcast  Recommendation

Oprah’s Super Soul Sunday: This inspirational series features programs that nourish the mind, body and spirit while offering insights into living one’s best life.

Insurance Benefits!
Did you know that all of our Acupuncturists are in-network with Insurance Companies!?  If you’re curious about your Acupuncture benefits, email us at hello@woodberrywellness.com and we can find out for you!

The post Reiki, Summer Reads and Acupuncture Insurance 🙌 appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: Teacher Summer Special!
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
SPREAD THE WORD! And get on Leah, Muraad and Melisa’s books before they fill up!!!   This week Tiffany, Gena and Muraad got the opportunity to be on the BMORE Lifestyle show on FOX 45 and talk to Char and Christina about Acupuncture! Click HERE to see how it went!   Get to know our beloved

The post Teacher Summer Special! appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
SPREAD THE WORD!

And get on Leah, Muraad and Melisa’s books before they fill up!!!

 

This week Tiffany, Gena and Muraad got the opportunity to be on the BMORE Lifestyle show on FOX 45 and talk to Char and Christina about Acupuncture!

Click HERE to see how it went!

 

Get to know our beloved Massage Therapist:

Leah Geslois, LMT

1. How did you get into massage therapy?

I had very early exposure to massage therapy starting when i was 6 or so. My mom was a Fed-ex delivery person and would spend most of her work hours on her feet. I offered to rub her feet for her one day and she paid me a $1 per minute. It became a regular exchange, but i didn’t know back then that I’d pursue a career in this field. I decided to enroll in the Therapeutic Massage program at AACC after i obtained an associates degree in Business and Art. “Well, why not?” is what i said to myself.

2. What is unique about your treatments?

My treatments aspire to target onset of pain that results from deviations in postural orientation as well as address energetic imbalances using vibrational frequencies emitted from the body.

From there, my goal for bodywork sessions is to help my clients reach a dream-like state of consciousness, where they can fully release the pressures of life for that duration of time. My intention is to create space to just be in that moment, immerse themselves into the experience.

3. What do you love most about your job?

It brings me much joy to establish deeper connections with my clients, where they feel they can be themselves in a safe space with me. I play the role of practitioner but I also make it known that i am there to support them in their life journey as well as their path of healing.

4. What homework do you like to give your clients?

After treatment sessions i educate my clients on what may be causing their pain and I’ll provide examples/demonstration of techniques to address it.

What I’ve noticed from my time in this field is that superficial pain often stems from musculoskeletal imbalances or poor posture. For instance, a person that spends much of their time on the computer will often present with shoulders that round forward, an indication that they have shortened muscles fibers in the chest, front of shoulders and neck. This can often result in pain in the upper back and back of neck because the muscles are being pulled forward since they also attach to bones of the shoulder girdle. In this scenario a person would present with short muscles in the front body and longer muscles on the opposite side or back body. To counteract this they could perform simple techniques such as rolling their shoulders backwards or squeezing their shoulder blades together to strengthen the back muscles consequently promoting flexibility in the chest and front of shoulders.

5. When you’re not massaging, what do you like to do on your off time?

I can’t go a day without practicing yoga. I also spend a lot of time hanging upside down from Aerial fabrics, gardening, reading, making art and playing with my dog Banjo.

The post Teacher Summer Special! appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: Happy Pride! And Welcome Melisa!
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
Happy Pride!!! Please welcome Melisa to the stage!!! Melisa Mitchell is an incredible Reiki practitioner who has been with us for a little while now as a renter, and has made the plunge to be an official team member/employee of Woodberry Wellness!  We couldn’t be more excited!!!  Melisa is passionate about the importance of self-care

The post Happy Pride! And Welcome Melisa! appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
Happy Pride!!!

Please welcome Melisa to the stage!!!

Melisa Mitchell is an incredible Reiki practitioner who has been with us for a little while now as a renter, and has made the plunge to be an official team member/employee of Woodberry Wellness!  We couldn’t be more excited!!!  Melisa is passionate about the importance of self-care and about empowering her clients to heal through Reiki. Reiki energy can be offered in support of conventional medical treatments for a variety of physical, mental, and emotional illnesses and conditions. Melisa has supported her clients in managing chronic pain, the side-effects of chemotherapy, migraines, grief, anxiety, insomnia, depression, effects of trauma and abuse, and addiction.

You can book your appointments with her this summer on Wednesday evenings, Thursday evenings and Sunday mornings!

Get to know our beloved Acupuncturist:

Jackson Miller M.Ac. L.Ac.

  1. What do you specialize in?  I specialize in LGBTQ+ health care, specifically fertility and transgender health.

  2. How did you get into this specialization?  After transitioning a decade ago, and starting a family with my wife, I realized that this community is under served. Too often, people in the LGBTQ community do not feel comfortable entering health care spaces for fear of shame and discrimination. I wanted to bring healing to this community, as well as create an affirming, safe space, in which people can come as they are. I am choosing to come out and be more visible as a practitioner so that the people who need my services the most can easily find me.

  3. What are some of the ways that acupuncture and Chinese medicine support issues specific to LGB/Trans* health?Acupuncture is a holistic modality that incorporates body, mind, and spirit. Our mental and spiritual health is just as important as our body health. Often our aches and pains can be exacerbated by our mental health. From this holistic lens, Chinese medicine can be supportive in treating a wide variety of imbalances that often affect people in the LGBTQ community. Some symptoms that acupuncture has success in treating include, anxiety, depression, and PTSD. Acupuncture specifically for transgender, genderfluid, gender queer, or non-binary people can be beneficial in supporting hormone replacement therapy, pain management after gender reassignment surgery, top surgery, hysterectomy, etc. Scar treatments can help in reducing the visibility of scarring as well as reducing the buildup of scar tissue post-surgery.
    Acupuncture is also beneficial in treating menstrual disorders, fertility including PCOS and endometriosis.

  4. What do you love most about it? I honestly love everything about treating this community. It is an honor being able to partner with patients on their journey of healing and self-discovery.

  5. What other issues do you enjoy treating? I enjoy treating a wide variety of issues including chronic and acute pain (back, knee, shoulder etc), Trauma, substance abuse, and eating disorders.

  6. Does someone have to be a part of the LGB/Trans* community to come see you?  Absolutely not! Anyone can come see me for acupuncture!   It is important to note that when a person comes out as LGBTQ+, often family and friends are experiencing a process of acceptance and healing. Acupuncture can be very beneficial as a family medicine.

  7. Do you accept insurance? Yes, I am currently in network with Cigna and BCBS and soon to be with Aetna, United and EHP. Please contact our office manager Jocelyn at hello@woodberrywellness.com directly to confirm if your insurance is accepted for treatment.  You may even have out of network benefits!

  8. Do you have any favorite resources for folks accessing information about LGB/Trans* health?

YES!

The National Center for Transgender Equality is the nation’s leading social justice advocacy organization winning life-saving change for transgender people.

https://transequality.org/

PFLAG is working to make sure that all people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer are not only valued by society, but take pride in and value themselves. We do this through providing peer-to-peer support, educating people on the issues that are important to the community, and advocating for inclusive policies and laws.

https://www.pflag.org/search?keys=transgender&type=resource

Transgender Law Center (TLC) is the largest national trans-led organization advocating self-determination for all people. Grounded in legal expertise and committed to racial justice, TLC employs a variety of community-driven strategies to keep transgender and gender nonconforming people alive, thriving, and fighting for liberation.

https://transgenderlawcenter.org/

GLCCB-To be a catalyst for uniting and empowering sexual and gender minorities in Baltimore and Central Maryland and advocate for a better quality of life for the entire community.

http://www.glccb.org/

Founded in 2003, Transgender Legal Defense & Education Fund is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit whose mission is to end discrimination and achieve equality for transgender people, particularly those in our most vulnerable communities.

http://www.transgenderlegal.org/

The Trans Youth Equality Foundation provides education, advocacy, and support for transgender children, youth, and their families.

http://www.transyouthequality.org/

The post Happy Pride! And Welcome Melisa! appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

The post Arthritis Month appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
MARK YOUR CALENDARS!

Because May 17th at 5:30pm we will be teaming up with the Arthritis Foundation and hosting a DEMO DAY event where we will be demonstrating our services on YOU to showcase how we can help with joint pain.  There will be raffle prizes, resources on how to get support and snacks!  Come get a massage, myofascial release, acupuncture, reiki, a raffle prize, some snacks and freebies!

Also, if you’re not sure what to get mom for mother’s day, we would love to treat them to some Acupuncture, Massage or Myofascial Release!  Drop by or give us a call at 410-878-0857 to get your Gift Certificate!

The post Arthritis Month appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: New Team Member & Give to Barcs!
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
We are incredibly excited to announce the arrival of a much anticipated member of our healing team, please help us welcome Kristine Shaw Southern! Kristine is from Ithaca NY and is in the process of relocating to Baltimore with her husband later this month, and we are having a difficult time containing our excitement. Kristine’s

The post New Team Member & Give to Barcs! appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
We are incredibly excited to announce the arrival of a much anticipated member of our healing team, please help us welcome Kristine Shaw Southern! Kristine is from Ithaca NY and is in the process of relocating to Baltimore with her husband later this month, and we are having a difficult time containing our excitement.

Kristine’s education in Traditional Chinese medicine began in 1998, where she learned the foundations of Chinese Medicine Theory, along with Traditional Amma and Shiatsu Therapy.  She received certification as a Shiatsu practitioner from Shiatsu Institute and Therapy Center in San Francisco.  She went on to receive additional certifications in deep tissue clinical massage, trigger point therapy, sports massage and myoskeletal alignment therapy.  Her various work experience includes; shiatsu practitioner at Fuji Shiatsu in SF,  physical therapy assistant at Golden Gate Physical Therapy in SF.  Her massage therapy experience includes settings in wellness spa’s as well as working with one of San Francisco’s most esteemed acupuncturists; Dr. Johnson You L.Ac. at his therapeutic massage and acupuncture clinic.

From an early age, Kristine was drawn to the vibrancy of Chinese medicine and would visit San Francisco’s Chinatown time and again.  She was fascinated by the varieties of tea and herbal medicinals she found there and made a point of learning more and more about them each time she revisited the colorful  district.  After years of visualizing a truly multidisciplinary approach to wellness, Kristine decided to pursue a Master’s degree in Traditional Chinese medicine and acupuncture with an emphasis in integrative sports medicine.

Kristine is one of the few acupuncturists who has apprenticed under one of the leading orthopedic, sports injury acupuncturists in the world, Whitfield Reaves, L.Ac. – practitioner to many US Olympic athletes! Deeply committed to the field of integrative medicine in both theory and practice, Kristine has remained true to her original vision and brings with her a rich background of education and experience.

It goes without saying that the benefits Kristine’s addition to WW offers our patients is beyond measure. We look forward to learning and exploring the perspective and treatments Kristine offers our patients who battle with sports injuries, acute & chronic pain, degenerative conditions such as musculoskeletal & autoimmune disorders, as well as mood disorders such as anxiety and stress related conditions, and womens health including menopausal and fertility issues.

Book with Kristine HERE

To celebrate the year of the dog, we are collecting supplies and money to donate to barcs in the month of April!

Here’s a wishlist of needed items for those they tend:

TOYS & ENRICHMENT

  • Kongs (Large and XL)
  • Nylabones (Large and XL)
  • Catch interactive feeder for dogs
  • Chuck-it balls (large)
  • Kong Goodie Bone
  • Feliway spray
  • Stretch and Scratch box for cats
  • Feather wand toys
  • Realistic/felt mouse toys (no catnip)

VETERINARY CARE

  • Kitchen Scales
  • Large heating disc
  • Triple antibiotic ointment or cream
  • Gauze (3”x3” 4PLY)
  • Latex Gloves (all sizes)
  • Non-Latex Gloves (large)
  • Digital Thermometers
  • Batteries- AAA, AA, 9V
  • New toothbrushes – Must be individually wrapped

KENNEL CARE

  • Blankets, comforters, towels, sheets (gently used accepted)
  • Shower curtains (non-transparent)
  • Stainless steel no-flip bowls (all sizes)
  • Nylon Flat Buckle Collars (16 – 20 inches, no plastic clip)
  • British slip leads (leash-type)
  • Kitten nursing bottles
  • Cat brushes
  • Baby Wipes
  • Medium and large plastic airline-type crates
  • Aromatherapy diffuser
  • Essential oils (lavender and chamomile)
  • Kuranda dog beds: If you would like to allow one more homeless dog to sleep in comfort, please donate a bed at our special wholesale price

FOOD & TREATS

  • Dog/puppy food – Dry and wet (unopened)
  • Cat/kitten food – Dry and wet (unopened)
  • Nutri-Cal Nutritional Supplement
  • Breeders Edge brand kitten replacement milk
  • Royal Canin – Babycat (wet/dry)
  • Zukes brand dog treats (Training Size)
  • Bully Sticks
  • Smooth Peanut Butter

CLEANING SUPPLIES

  • Paper towels (regular and industrial)
  • Dawn Dish detergent
  • Lint Rollers
  • Plastic Watering cans
  • Hand Sanitizer

OFFICE SUPPLIES

  • Copy paper (white, blue, pink, yellow, purple, blue)
  • Index card (3×5 white, pink, blue)
  • Dry erase markers (fine point)
  • Plastic clipboards
  • Duct tape
  • Moving Dollys

The post New Team Member & Give to Barcs! appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.

item.title: Growing and Thriving
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Houchins
item.description:
We have Great News We are so grateful to all of you for giving us the opportunity to serve, heal, support and care for our community. As our client base continues to grow, we must grow to meet the needs of those we serve. Over the past year we began to seek additional health professionals

The post Growing and Thriving appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
item.content:encoded:
We have Great News

We are so grateful to all of you for giving us the opportunity to serve, heal, support and care for our community.

As our client base continues to grow, we must grow to meet the needs of those we serve. Over the past year we began to seek additional health professionals that are both uniquely qualified and highly talented healers, allowing us to deepen the integrative wellness practice we are able to offer our patients. We are bubbling over with excitement to announce these incredible practitioners as part of our team!

Meet Jackson Miller L.Ac.!

Jackson is an amazing acupuncturist who will be joining us on Tuesday and Friday evenings, soon to be more!  Jackson has a loving bedside manner, is an excellent listener and is gifted in asking questions that get right to the root of whatever issue you are facing. He specializes in Women’s Health, Fertility, LGBTQ health and Pain Management.  Receiving acupuncture from him is truly a gift and after searching high and low we couldn’t be happier to find the PERFECT acupuncturist to join our team!

Meet Leah Gesois LMT!

Leah is an amazing massage therapist who just added Thursday hours to her schedule!  Leah has merged her knowledge in physical therapy, human anatomy, massage therapy and energy work to offer sessions that aim to heal the Body, Mind and Spirit with Integrative Bodywork Sessions.  You won’t want to miss out!

Meet Muraad Pope NASM PT!

Muraad is a one of a kind Corrective Exercise Therapist who specializes in Myofascial Release Bodywork.  His treatments are utilized to treat sciatica, plantar fasciitis, injured rotator cuffs, knees, hips and much more. He has availability on Mondays and Fridays.  If you have acute or chronic pain of any kind, he is working miracles!

APPOINTMENTS WITH MURAAD & LEAH ARE 20% OFF IN THE MONTH OF MARCH!

The post Growing and Thriving appeared first on Woodberry Wellness.
